thread.title: Nietes’ wish: An audience with PNoy
thread.title_full: Nietes’ wish: An audience with PNoy | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: October 19, 2015
title: Nietes’ wish: An audience with PNoy
text:
October 19, 2015 By Dennis Principe
There is one honor which world boxing champion Donnie “Ahas” Nietes considers as the missing piece that will make his record-breaking reign truly a remarkable one.
The 33-year-old Murcia-native titleholder said it has been his earnest wish to return to Malacañang and be feted once more by no less than President Aquino after setting a distinct record for a Filipino world boxing champion.
Nietes, who has been a two-division ruler for eight years now, broke the longtime record of the legendary Gabriel “Flash” Elorde who held the world junior lightweight crown for seven years and three months from 1960 to 1967.
“Hindi siguro magiging kumpleto ang pagiging world champion ko kung hindi ako maiimbita ulit ni Presidente Aquino,” said Nietes in a telephone interview.
Nietes recently defended his World Boxing Organization (WBO) lightflyweight crown by scoring an impressive 12-round decision victory over Juan Alejo of Mexico Sunday at the StubHub Center in Carson, California.
In 2012, Nietes together with then-fellow world kingpins Johnriel Casimero and Sonny Boy Jaro paid a courtesy call to President Aquino in Malacañang.
“Iba siguro ngayon kasi ako na lang ang world champion. Sana magkaroon ng chance na makilala ni PNoy yung achievement ko,” said Nietes.
Nietes became one of the top fighters of the famed ALA Promotions when he pocketed the vacant WBO world minimumweight title by decisioning Pornsawan Porpramook of Thailand on September 30, 2007 in Cebu.
